column4: I have an 80 gig HD and a 120 gig HD but ubuntu only installed on 7 gigs of one of the disks. Can I get the rest of the space used or do I have to reinstall ubuntu?
create a bigger partition. resize the ubuntu partition
how do I resize?
use a gparted livecd
no
when i create a partition it always wants me to say where I want it moutned
fdisk -l
he uses a liveCD. fstab doesn't really matter
yes. what filesystemn(s) on the disk?
it just says extended
extended is not a filesystem but partitiontype
yeah I dunno what fs is on it
fdisk -l sorta told you
what was weird is that when i installed ubunut it was telling me that it could not mess with the second HD because it already had an os on it and it did not want to break it
well I am gonna install 7.10 right over my 7.04 so hopefully it won't give me the same crap that my first install gave me
what has this to do with what filesystem is on disk two?
dunno, so how do I find out what fs is on disk two?
as I said: fdisk -l gave you a hint
by the size of the sectors and stuff?
no, by partition type
e.g. ntfs, win95 lba, etc
system column
yeah all it says under system is extended
